text: Yea we have always used site search 360 for more complex indexing needs. Most of the time we can get away with the native HS search, I just never dug into how it works until now and am a bit disappointed. But I suppose it also makes sense why they would implement it that way. Maybe a cheap get around could be to impose a percentage match threshold. Maybe it’s also not a big deal for the client. But Its def bugging me hahaha
Yeah, I've definitely seen a couple of other threads in here about it. Even saw someone once us a custom object and the crm search api

Hey :wave: i’m having issue connecting my app with a customer’s env, it’s failing with error: “hub does not have access to the required scopes” any idea? this worked for me I tried to connect with the my test account.
This, is usually because you're trying to access a feature that the hub doesn't have access to. most common one is custom objects
Because custom objects are only available on enterprise accounts and above
<@U01QVR44MEY> Hey but I am not able to see any syncing APIs

thanks, I don’t think we are using it, where can I see the list of features?

this is the list of scopes i’m using:
```timeline,analytics.behavioral_events.send,crm.lists.read,crm.objects.contacts.read,crm.objects.contacts.write,crm.schemas.contacts.read,crm.objects.companies.read,crm.objects.companies.write,crm.schemas.companies.read,crm.schemas.deals.read```
